citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS)
citeinfo.title: Broad-scale Zooplankton Surveys in 1994-1998

descript.abstract:
Fish eggs and larvae and zooplankton were sampled along 15-20 transect lines off the southern Washington and Oregon coasts, from 2 to 100 miles from shore during July 1994 and 1995, June 1996, and July 1997 and 1998. Plankton sampling was done with a 25 cm CalVET net fitted with 150 Âµm mesh nets. CTD casts to 70 m were done and nutrient and chlorophyll samples were collected from 3 m depth at each station.
[ Reference: PICES Scientific Report No. 18 2001, Proceedings of the PICES/CoML/IPRC Workshop on "Impact of Climate Variability on Observation and Prediction of Ecosystem and Biodiversity Changes in the North Pacific", http://www.pices.int/publications/scientific_reports/Report18/default.aspx. ]
descript.purpose: To map the distribution and abundance of anchovy and sardines eggs and larvae in relation to hydrography and zooplankton abundance.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
